briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study of MYOBLOC速 Followed by Open-Label Multiple-Treatment With MYOBLOC速 in the Treatment of Troublesome Sialorrhea in Adult Subjects
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single-Treatment Efficacy and Safety Study of MYOBLOC速 (Part A) Followed by Open-Label, Multiple-Treatment With MYOBLOC速 (Part B) in the Treatment of Troublesome Sialorrhea in Adult Subjects
summary: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of MYOBLOC in the treatment of Sialorrhea (drooling), which can be a symptom of many disease conditions. MYOBLOC will be injected directly into the salivary glands. MYOBLOC has been shown in previous trials to safely decrease saliva production, thereby demonstrating its potential as a safe and effective treatment for troublesome sialorrhea.

primaryOutcome.measure: Unstimulated Salivary Flow Rate (USFR) at Week 4 Post-injection Visit (Part A)
